intro: Sisyrinchium minus subsp. minus, commonly known as the lesser blue-eyed grass, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue to violet flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically blooms in early spring and is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate appearance and early flowering habit. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller size and more compact growth compared to other subspecies of Sisyrinchium.
